Package model

Class UserDAO

java.lang.Object
model.UserDAO
public class UserDAO
extends java.lang.Object
this class's main purpose is to connect to the database and get User objects. Moreover, it offers methods to add/delete users, get the a user's information, and finally assign multiple users as friends.

See Also:
ConnectorDB, ResultSet, Config, User

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    UserDAO()
    a default constructor to be able to have an instance of this class and access it's methods from other classes
    UserDAO​(Config configuration)
    this method is used to initialize the UserDAO using the configuration of the database, so we can connect to the database.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean addFriendById​(java.lang.String idCurrentUser, java.lang.String idFriend)
    links the two users provided together as friends
    java.lang.String authenticateUser​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
    this method checks the credentials of the user
    boolean deleteUserById​(java.lang.String code)
    deletes a user from the database when provided the user's id
    void disconnect()
    disconnects the UserDAO from the database
    void editUser​(User user)
    this method updates the information of a user in the database
    java.util.ArrayList<User> getFriendsById​(java.lang.String code)
    gets all the friends that corresponds to the user with the id provided in the parameters
    User getUserById​(java.lang.String code)
    this method gets the information of a user by their Id
    boolean registerUser​(User user)
    this class registers a new user in the system and adds them to the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserDAO

      public UserDAO​(Config configuration)
      this method is used to initialize the UserDAO using the configuration of the database, so we can connect to the database.
      Parameters:
      configuration - an object that contains the info of the database name, port, user name, and the password to connect.
      See Also:
      Config, ConnectorDB

    • UserDAO

      public UserDAO()
      a default constructor to be able to have an instance of this class and access it's methods from other classes

  • Method Details

    • registerUser

      public boolean registerUser​(User user) throws UsernameAlreadyExistsException, EmailAlreadyExistsException
      this class registers a new user in the system and adds them to the database.
      Parameters:
      user - the user to be added to the database, the user doesn't need to have a code as this code will be assigned to them after the user is added to the database.
      Returns:
      it returns a boolean saying wither the the user has been added successfully or not
      Throws:
      UsernameAlreadyExistsException - if the nickname already is repeated and already exists in the database
      EmailAlreadyExistsException - if the email already is repeated and already exists in the database

    • authenticateUser

      public java.lang.String authenticateUser​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password) throws UserNameNotFoundException, WrongPasswordException
      this method checks the credentials of the user
      Parameters:
      username - the nickname or the login of the user attempting to login
      password - the password of the user attempting to login
      Returns:
      the id of the user if the credentials were valid, or -1 if the login was not successful
      Throws:
      UserNameNotFoundException - if the the nickname/email didn't exist in the database
      WrongPasswordException - if the password didn't match the nickname/email provided

    • getUserById

      public User getUserById​(java.lang.String code) throws UserNotFoundException
      this method gets the information of a user by their Id
      Parameters:
      code - the id of the user
      Returns:
      the information of the user as User object
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if the id provided didn't correspond to any of the users registered in the system
      See Also:
      User

    • editUser

      public void editUser​(User user) throws UserNotFoundException
      this method updates the information of a user in the database
      Parameters:
      user - the user that contains the new information
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if the id provided didn't correspond to any of the users registered in the system
      See Also:
      User

    • addFriendById

      public boolean addFriendById​(java.lang.String idCurrentUser, java.lang.String idFriend) throws UserNotFoundException, SameUserException
      links the two users provided together as friends
      Parameters:
      idCurrentUser - the id of the user who made the request
      idFriend - the id of the user that the current user will be linked to
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating if the process was successful
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if any of the IDs provided doesn't correspond to a user in the database
      SameUserException

    • getFriendsById

      public java.util.ArrayList<User> getFriendsById​(java.lang.String code)
      gets all the friends that corresponds to the user with the id provided in the parameters
      Parameters:
      code - the id of the user who made the request
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of all the users that are friends with the provided user

    • deleteUserById

      public boolean deleteUserById​(java.lang.String code) throws UserNotFoundException
      deletes a user from the database when provided the user's id
      Parameters:
      code - the id of the user to be deleted
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating if the process was successful
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if the user's id was not found in the database

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      disconnects the UserDAO from the database
      See Also:
      ConnectorDB
